Class WidgetViewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • WidgetViewer

  • public class WidgetViewer
extends java.lang.Object
    A really simple class to display Swing widgets in absolute Layout GUI.

    Author:
    parks

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_X_SIZE
      This is the width of the JFrame if no value is specified on the constructor
      static int DEFAULT_Y_SIZE
      This is the height of the JFrame if no value is specified on the constructor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WidgetViewer()
      Default constructor will display an empty JFrame that has an Absolute layout JPanel as its content pane and initialize the frame to a default size.
      WidgetViewer(int pixelSizeInX, int pixelSizeInY)
      Constructor will display an empty JFrame that has an Absolute layout JPanel as its content pane and initialize the frame to a given size.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(javax.swing.JComponent jcomp)
      Add a widget to the frame.
      void add(javax.swing.JComponent jcomp, int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Add a Swing widget to the GUI.
      void addAndWait(javax.swing.AbstractButton absButton)
      Add an Abstract Button (like a JButton) to the JFrame.
      void addAndWait(javax.swing.JTextField jTextField)
      Add a JTextField to the JFrame, and wait for the user to put the cursor in the field and click Enter.
      void addButtonAndWait(java.lang.String prompt)
      Convenience method to create a JButton with the given text and use it in an addAndWait.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_X_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_X_SIZE
        This is the width of the JFrame if no value is specified on the constructor
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_Y_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_Y_SIZE
        This is the height of the JFrame if no value is specified on the constructor
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • WidgetViewer

        public WidgetViewer()
        Default constructor will display an empty JFrame that has an Absolute layout JPanel as its content pane and initialize the frame to a default size.

      • WidgetViewer

        public WidgetViewer(int pixelSizeInX,
                    int pixelSizeInY)
        Constructor will display an empty JFrame that has an Absolute layout JPanel as its content pane and initialize the frame to a given size.
        Parameters:
        pixelSizeInX - The width, in pixels, of this WidgetViewer frame
        pixelSizeInY - The height, in pixels, of this WidgetViewer frame

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(javax.swing.JComponent jcomp,
                int x,
                int y,
                int w,
                int h)
        Add a Swing widget to the GUI. GUI coordinates start at the top left corner of the frame, and are measured in pixels.
        • x increases horizontally to (to the right)
        • y increases vertically GOING DOWN.
        Parameters:
        jcomp - Swing widget (subclasses of JComponent--like JLabel and JTextField) to be added to the JFrame
        x - the x value of this widget's top left corner
        y - the y value of this widget's top left corner
        w - the width, in pixels, of this widget
        h - the height, in pixels, of this widget

      • add

        public void add(javax.swing.JComponent jcomp)
        Add a widget to the frame. We take a guess at the positioning and size based on the previously added widget. If the guess turns out badly, switch to the other signature for the add method.
        Parameters:
        jcomp - widget to be added

      • addAndWait

        public void addAndWait(javax.swing.AbstractButton absButton)
        Add an Abstract Button (like a JButton) to the JFrame. Create an action listener to wait (suspend the caller) until it is clicked.
        Parameters:
        absButton - Button (like a JButton) to add to the JFrame

      • addButtonAndWait

        public void addButtonAndWait(java.lang.String prompt)
        Convenience method to create a JButton with the given text and use it in an addAndWait.
        Parameters:
        prompt - Text for the JButton to display

      • addAndWait

        public void addAndWait(javax.swing.JTextField jTextField)
        Add a JTextField to the JFrame, and wait for the user to put the cursor in the field and click Enter. The caller is suspended until enter is clicked.
        Parameters:
        jTextField - Field to add to the JFrame
